abstract: BlackRock is looking at an average annual inflow of more than $200 billion over the next five years, the firm’s president, Robert Kapito, told Bloomberg News.
snippet: BlackRock is looking at an average annual inflow of more than $200 billion over the next five years, the firm’s president, Robert Kapito, told Bloomberg News.
lead_paragraph: BlackRock is looking at an average annual inflow of more than $200 billion over the next five years, following its $15.2 billion acquisition of Barclays Global Investors last year, the firm’s president, Robert Kapito,  told Bloomberg News.

headline.main: BlackRock May Win $200 Billion a Year in Inflows
